job_Description: PRIMARY PURPOSE: The Director of Strategic Data and Information Management continually evaluates how CIO functions can be centralized in support of seamless business collaboration, develops, and implements innovative strategic roadmaps to support the Bank’s commercial organic and inorganic growth models, and manages cross-functional and virtual teams. The role is focused on both establishing a Data Governance Program (DGP) and identifying the appropriate tools for the Bank’s Lines of Business (LOB) to effectively aid in the use of data to support LOB functions. Specific to tools, the SD will initially focus on Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML). Accomplishments expected include: a iterative evaluation of the CIO Organization and implement changes to support the Bank’s current and future needs, establish a DGP commensurate with the Federal definition of a medium sized financial institution, develope of a team to support DGP implementation and identify AI/ML tools, and positive increases in LOB measured performance. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Establish and lead a team of Data Architects, AI/ML Analysts, Data Modelers, Data Governance Engineers, and Sentiment Analysis Analysts. Engage with cross-functional and virtual teams to architect and develop reliable and scalable end-to-end Information Technology (IT) and Application and Information Services (AIS) solutions. Architect innovative CIO platforms supporting internal and external stakeholders working side-by-side with key Bank components. Establish a DGP, to include a Data Governance Charter, DGP Framework, Data Strategy, and DGP roadmap to achieve DGP sustainability. Develop a Global Data Architecture and Analytics standard collaborating with key stakeholders to translate business, technical, and functional requirements into a cohesive, measurable standard. In partnership with the CIO’s Project Management Office (PMO), engage with all Bank LOBs to ensure implementation of a DGP and Data Strategy and adoption of consistent standards and relevant capabilities. Generate and monitor Professional Development Plans for the SD Team to position each individual for success and future growth opportunities both within the CIO Organization and the Bank. Develop and implement procedures, systems, and teams to oversee the execution of tasks related to the DGP. Develop and implement the people and communication strategy to support implementation of the Bank’s DGP, including the development and execution of training programs. Support the PMO in conducting key activities and preparing materials for regulatory touchpoints and milestones. Engage in Professional Development activities to further develop expertise in data tools and capabilities, to include AI/ML. Develop a successful Knowledge Transfer program for the SD Team to ensure continuity and adoption of best practices. JOB SPECIFICATIONS: Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Proven ability in translating requirements in public, private, and government environments. Extensive knowledge in developing a Data Strategy and implementing a Data Analysis standard incorporating key Subject Matter Experts’ input. Successfully able to bridge the gap between business and technology requirements. Indisputable track record accomplishing tactical and strategic efforts driving innovation, dealing with ambiguity, and empowering others. Knowledge of legal, regulatory, and financial compliance, as well as data privacy laws, to include GDPR, CCPA, CPRA, VCDPA, Right to be Forgotten, and the Patriot Act. Ablity to lead and grow a small direct team of 2-5 people and larger virtual teams and contractors. Proven ability in managing and mentoring team members taking a keen interest in one’s Professional Development Plan. Ability to translate requirements and business use cases/outcomes, data sources and management concepts, and analytical approaches/options across all levels of management and individual contributor level. Excellent business acumen and interpersonal skills; able to work across banking Lines Of Business (LOB) at a senior level to influence and effect change to achieve mutuals goals. Proven ability to balance team and individual responsibilities, build teams and consensus, and get things done through others not directly under his/her supervision. Effective change management skills with an ability to support and adapt within a changing environment. Capacity to think laterally, demonstrate through leadership, and convey an understanding of the big picture. General understanding of the Bank’s business practices and familiarities with it’s LOBs. Proven presentation and communication skills to present and implement solutions, best practices, and methodologies on the national and international scale. Project, program, and portfolio management exposure on the national and international scale.
